climbs.name: Walkabout
climbs.fa: Tom Slater and the Ross Brothers

content.description:
This is a fairly direct line straight up from the very bottom.

After the initial low angle climbing to the base of the steeper plated wall, head up just left of center. At the top, the wall will get even steeper. Chain anchors at the top. Honestly, you can wander anywhere as long as you have slings. Awesome plates everywhere. Almost too much fun.
content.protection: Bring 6-10 two foot slings and gear to 1".
content.location: Dances with Knobs starts just right of Didgeridude. This route starts at the bottom of the low angle slab. Head up this, up a steep piece, past a bulge/roof on your left and then the real climbing begins at the base of the steep plated wall. Aim up just left of the center of this face.

content.description: An effort was made to squeeze every inch out of this line. This is the longest line on the cliff. If you enjoy the classic plate climbs at Shuteye, you'll want to climb this route (and all the routes on this wall). Fun to climb with just a rack of slings.
content.protection: 6-10 two foot slings, single gear to 1".
content.location: Start at the bottom right of the low angle slabs at the large right-facing flake and then head up, aiming for the right side of the plated face, just missing the transition ledge (which all other routes intersect before heading up the steeper wall). Notes: All of these 5.7s reach the same anchor. Most of the lines are longer than 100' but a 60m rope will get you down to where you can reach the ground safely. Me and Dingo 5.7 is the line to the left of Rite of Passage (FA Justin Ross) and goes up the middle of the plated face.

content.description:
A nice clip-up on a highly featured and steep face, this route is a wonderful climb that would have a huge line if it were alongside the road rather than in the middle of nowhere.

Locate the detached pointy boulder to the right of the water chute in the center of the face.  Climb this, clip a bolt under a bulge, then trend up and left toward the water chute past six more bolts to a pair of bolts with quicklink that serve as an anchor for this and Bullroarer, the .11b to the left.
content.location: Easy to spot just to the right of the water chute that divides the highly-featured face in half.

content.description:
Just to the right of Didgeridude are four 5.7s that are all natural and are really fun. Basically, pick a line and go up to a bolted anchor. Take a light rack and some slings. Rap from the top. No face bolts.

Left to right:

Dances With Knobs

Walkabout (best of the bunch) This is the route found directly below the anchor.

Me and Dingo

Rite of Passage

All 5.7 FAs Tom Slater and Justin Ross, 2010
content.protection: One of everything up to 1", half-dozen 2' thin slings.
content.location: All four 5.7s go up to a bolted anchor. All start at the very bottom of the slab and go over the overlap above and then up an amazingly featured face that is just a blast to climb.

content.description: Thin slab to start leading to more moderate juggy terrain.
content.location: The bolted line on the left side of the formation.
